intro: Nonatelia borbonica, commonly known as the Bourbon nonatelia, is a tropical plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
